column4: hey all, how can i install splash screens that i downloaded from gnome website?
splash screens for what?
all you can change on the login screen is the wallpaper and the colour of the login box, those things are for gdm1, the currently supported ubuntus use gdm2
http://maketecheasier.com/change-login-and-boot-screen-in-ubuntu-lucid/2010/05/13
you could use the wallpaper maybe
http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/ubuntu/add-the-trash-can-icon-to-your-ubuntu-desktop/
its quite simple, gconf is not disimilar to XP enabling the trash on desktop
http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/ubuntu/change-ssh-welcome-banner-on-ubuntu/
is your RAM and partition healthy?
yes
what is the output of: lsb_release -d
its always been the same
just login as root, what could possibly go wrong ;)
root login is a really bad idea and not advised at all
i know, i was being a smartass :P
i see
run:   sudo apt-get clean    it will happen for you
ty, ill do that :)
you seem to be a pretty knowledgable guy, what do you use to track down disk space?
there is disk space analyser but I keep my OS trim. You can remove old kernels to regain 120Mb per kernel
yeah, im trying to cut back... its at 14 gigs right now and I have no idea where it's hiding all this extra data ;)
run:  uname -a   this is the current kernel
run:  dpkg -l | grep linux-image-2    those are the installed kernels
yeah right now i have 2 (plus their recovery). want to make sure this update went good before i remove them
